title: What are the Chinese equivalents of Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube? - Quora
tags: What Is the Chinese Equivalent of X?

response.answer_text: There aren't any perfect equivalents, but roughly speaking, Facebook has its analogs in Renren.com and Sina Weibo (the former more resembles Facebook in its layout and its functions, the latter is something of a cross between Facebook and Twitter; Twitter is closest to Sina Weibo; and YouTube is probably the easiest to analogize, with Youku-Tudou (though the Internet video market in China is far more fragmented with many strong competitors, including iQiyi and Sohu.

There aren't any. Facebook, Twitter and YouTube are INTERNATIONAL websites. China is only ONE country. There isn't any good competeive or alternate websites that could possibly rival them in the world, lest in China, a country where internartional brands are pretty non-existent.Besides Youku, Tudou and others could not been possibly compared to YouTube where UGC (use-generated conent) is prevalent. Those Chinese "equivalents" all of you mention here are mostly for streaming dramas or movies.
